dublin_core.dcvalue: A new series of N pyrimidin 2 yl benzenesulfonamide derivatives 3a 3i and 4a 4i was synthesized from pyrimidin 2 amines 2a 2i with the aim to explore their effects on in vitro growth of Entamoeba histolytica The chemical structures of the compounds were elucidated by elemental analysis FT IR 1 H and 13 C NMR and ESI mass spectral data In vitro anti amoebic activity was evaluated against HM1 IMSS strain of Entamoeba histolytica The IC50 values were calculated by using the double dilution method The results were compared with the IC50 value of the standard drug metronidazole The selected compounds were tested for their cytotoxic activities by cell viability assay using H9C2 cardiac myoblasts cell line and the results indicated that all the compounds displayed remarkable 80 viabilities to a concentration of 100 g ml
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-06T19:32:55Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2013-12-11
Synthesis, characterization, and anti-amoebic activity of N-(pyrimidin-2-yl)benzenesulfonamide derivatives.
